tags: jon named dany his queen because he believes in her
he sees beyond the dragons and titles and armies
he sees beyond petty northern politics
summary: Jon has truly never seen a girl like this before.  Her beauty, her strength, her grief and the pain it makes him feel...they all...
body:
Jon’s thoughts right before naming Dany his Queen

Jon has truly never seen a girl like this before. Her beauty, her strength, her grief and the pain it makes him feel…they all push him to the realization that he loves her.

Jon sees what so many have seen over the years: the force within Dany that enables her to conquer everything in her path.

— Game of Thrones // Beyond the Wall // 7.06

i know I'm late to this argument but
i checked my discord and saw everyone talking about it
and it bothered me enough to rant about it a little
summary: It took a bit but I'm finally getting annoyed by the ”jon was thinking with his penis” comment.  I thought it was pretty obvious...
body:
It took a bit but I’m finally getting annoyed by the ”jon was thinking with his penis” comment. I thought it was pretty obvious that he wasn’t doing that. Men that think with their dick are totally different and a fair amount of them seem to be players, which Jon obviously isn’t bc players tell you what you wanna hear to get in bed with you. Jon did not tell Daenerys what she wanted to hear or do what she wanted him to so there’s that (like a lot of girls I’ve met my fair share of players so I’m not talking about something completely unfamiliar to me). Plus, he’s honest so deception is not his thing and never will be. And Jon hasn’t ever been the think with his dick type anyway.

Finding someone attractive isn’t ”thinking with his penis”. He didn’t even pursue Daenerys after finding her attractive! He waited till he knew what kind of person she was. That’s not ”thinking with his penis”. I’m kinda disappointed Maisie said that.

tags: this has been on my mind for a long time
summary: In defense of Catelyn Stark
body:
In defense of Catelyn Stark

*Please refrain from sending me any hateful comments, thank you for being a decent person. Also: Yes, I know Jon Snow is Lyanna’s son and Ned Stark died faithful to Catelyn but it is important to remember that Catelyn does not know that as no one told her.*

I always see hate towards Catelyn for being less than welcoming towards Jon. It should be remembered that she was told he was Ned Stark bastards, meaning he cheated on her. Imagine if your significant other cheated on you; would you not be angry? Now imagine that your s.o. is well renowned for being the most honorable and rule-following person as they cheated on you. Would that not make you feel so insignificant? That this man who you got on with well enough in the little time you have been married to, would not let others undress you during the wedding because he already liked you/looking out for your well being, criticized King Robert for condoning war crimes, broke the promise of marriage to be with someone else. That alone would hurt. Now, what if you are married to your s.o. and they brought home a baby from another woman that you did not know? Would you welcome that child with open arms like your own as he is the reminder that this honorable man, your husband, was with another woman? Catelyn could not even send Jon away, which means that Ned Stark, her husband, favored Jon (and, henceforth, his mother) over her, his wife and mother of his legitimate child and heir as he denied her wishes. This can also be dangerous since Jon is so close in age to Rob that he could try to be the heir, much like the whole Blackfyre rebellion.

Catelyn not being motherly towards Jon was hurtful towards him growing up, I will admit that. Knowing someone constantly did not want you around hurts. Remember, though, other women react worse than Catelyn in response to bastards. Cersei insinuated to Robert that Mya Stone would die if she came to Kings Landing to be raised and kills the baby Barra along with her mother. So Catelyn’s silent treatment seems far better than murder since Jon Snow survived his childhood. Catelyn did maintain humanity towards Jon as she prayed that he would not die of pox, even making a prayer wheel for him. It can be argued that earlier she prayed for his death, but Catelyn does recognize that Jon was no more than an innocent child that was on the receiving end of her jealousy of his mother. Even when she returns to ignoring Jon after the pox she knows she is being cruel to an already unfortunate boy, “a motherless child”.

In short: If someone cheated on you, you would dump them immediately. Catelyn is unable to do that, so yes, there is tension. She is undoubtedly unhappy that Jon is being raised along with her sons and chooses to ignore him, yet is still sympathetic towards him as she prays for his recovery of the pox and knows that her anger towards him is unjust.

Bae over Bay
"Follow your inner moonlight. Don't hide the madness." -Allen Ginsberg

summary: While I guess I can see why people are thinking Daenerys might turn evil, I personally think they are getting the wrong idea of...
body:
While I guess I can see why people are thinking Daenerys might turn evil, I personally think they are getting the wrong idea of what the writers are really doing. I think that they need to give little hints that she might be losing control to make Tyrion more on the fence about supporting her over his family. He was so invested in the idea that Dany was going to come in and fix everything, but after what happened with the Tarlys, he became worried that as good as she is, she could always become like her father.

But really, I don’t think actually making her turn out like the Mad King makes sense with her series long narrative. People concentrate too much on what she allows others to see, rather than understanding what her true motivations are. The way I see it, she doesn’t really want to conquer anyone. I don’t think she even wants to rule. I think mainly she wants to feel like she’s home. LIke she isn’t the last of her family line.  Like she could do some good after her father destroyed everything. But as time goes on and things get harder she gets angry and desperate. Despite being the Mother of Dragons she often feels powerless, so she uses her dragons and authority to feel like she can regain control. But I don’t think that makes her evil, especially by GoT standards. She just needs a better less destructive outlet.

I think that’s why it’s a good thing that she has Jon now. He has a lot of the same feelings that she does. He doesn’t really want to lead and rule, but he feels like he has to, to see the change his people need. At the same time, he is so bound by honor he is not able to go to the extremes Dany does. Seeing everything in black and white doesn’t always help him, however. I think them coming together can help them see that they aren’t always making the right decisions. Maybe he can help her from falling over the edge while she can help him accept the things he has to do to get where he needs to go.

reblog.comment:

He doesn’t really want to lead and rule, but he feels like he has to, to see the change his people need. At the same time, he is so bound by honor he is not able to go to the extremes Dany does. Seeing everything in black and white doesn’t always help him, however. I think them coming together can help them see that they aren’t always making the right decisions. Maybe he can help her from falling over the edge while she can help him accept the things he has to do to get where he needs to go.

trail.content_raw:
While I guess I can see why people are thinking Daenerys might turn evil, I personally think they are getting the wrong idea of what the writers are really doing. I think that they need to give little hints that she might be losing control to make Tyrion more on the fence about supporting her over his family. He was so invested in the idea that Dany was going to come in and fix everything, but after what happened with the Tarlys, he became worried that as good as she is, she could always become like her father.

But really, I don’t think actually making her turn out like the Mad King makes sense with her series long narrative. People concentrate too much on what she allows others to see, rather than understanding what her true motivations are. The way I see it, she doesn’t really want to conquer anyone. I don’t think she even wants to rule. I think mainly she wants to feel like she’s home. LIke she isn’t the last of her family line.  Like she could do some good after her father destroyed everything. But as time goes on and things get harder she gets angry and desperate. Despite being the Mother of Dragons she often feels powerless, so she uses her dragons and authority to feel like she can regain control. But I don’t think that makes her evil, especially by GoT standards. She just needs a better less destructive outlet.

I think that’s why it’s a good thing that she has Jon now. He has a lot of the same feelings that she does. He doesn’t really want to lead and rule, but he feels like he has to, to see the change his people need. At the same time, he is so bound by honor he is not able to go to the extremes Dany does. Seeing everything in black and white doesn’t always help him, however. I think them coming together can help them see that they aren’t always making the right decisions. Maybe he can help her from falling over the edge while she can help him accept the things he has to do to get where he needs to go.
trail.content:
While I guess I can see why people are thinking Daenerys might turn evil, I personally think they are getting the wrong idea of what the writers are really doing. I think that they need to give little hints that she might be losing control to make Tyrion more on the fence about supporting her over his family. He was so invested in the idea that Dany was going to come in and fix everything, but after what happened with the Tarlys, he became worried that as good as she is, she could always become like her father.

But really, I don’t think actually making her turn out like the Mad King makes sense with her series long narrative. People concentrate too much on what she allows others to see, rather than understanding what her true motivations are. The way I see it, she doesn’t really want to conquer anyone. I don’t think she even wants to rule. I think mainly she wants to feel like she’s home. LIke she isn’t the last of her family line.  Like she could do some good after her father destroyed everything. But as time goes on and things get harder she gets angry and desperate. Despite being the Mother of Dragons she often feels powerless, so she uses her dragons and authority to feel like she can regain control. But I don’t think that makes her evil, especially by GoT standards. She just needs a better less destructive outlet.

I think that’s why it’s a good thing that she has Jon now. He has a lot of the same feelings that she does. He doesn’t really want to lead and rule, but he feels like he has to, to see the change his people need. At the same time, he is so bound by honor he is not able to go to the extremes Dany does. Seeing everything in black and white doesn’t always help him, however. I think them coming together can help them see that they aren’t always making the right decisions. Maybe he can help her from falling over the edge while she can help him accept the things he has to do to get where he needs to go.

summary: I have played possibly the unfunniest character ever to have graced television. I love comedy. But Jon Snow is not a joke...
text: I have played possibly the unfunniest character ever to have graced television. I love comedy. But Jon Snow is not a joke person.
source: Kit Harington quoted in People – apparently originally from Emmy magazine.
